featured.text: Many employees don’t like a conservative dress code.
An open display of ______ behavior between men and women, such as hugging and kissing, is not allowed in some conservative societies.
“A lot of young people don’t want to dress up for work,” says the owner of a software company, “so it’s hard to hire people if you have a conservative dress code.”
Research also suggests that firstborn children generally become more conservative than other children because they receive most of the parental discipline.

definition.zh_def: 保守的，通常指在政治、社會或文化上持有傳統觀點的人或思想。
definition.en_def: Holding to traditional attitudes and values, typically in relation to politics or religion.
definition.example: He has conservative views on social issues.
